poem:
Deed

A paper the color of old tea
kept refolding itself through empires,
Ottoman to British to Jordanian
to the hard stamp of occupation.

Each time, the same hillside
answered to the same hands.

Now ministers eye the valleys
as if a gift were inventory.

But the family speaks its quiet verb:
to pass on,
to pass on.
